c74object.name: the.perlin~
c74object.digest: Generate Perlin-Noise function with easing interpolation
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Reads from Ken Perlins procedural noise function and interpolates between successive values for pseudo-random progressions. The output is either normalized or signed.

objarg.name: initial-frequency
objarg.description: Initial frequency in Hz. Any non-zero incoming signal will override the initial frequency, see the signal method.

attribute.name: ease
attribute.description:
Easing interpolation between successive values.
10 Easing functions are available, all of which interpolate birectionally:
0 = Quadratic
1 = Cubic
2 = Quartic
3 = Quintic
4 = Sine
5 = Circular
6 = Exponential
7 = Elastic
8 = Back
9 = Bounce
The default is 4 (Sine).

attribute.name: ease_amt
attribute.digest: Amount of easing to be applied
attribute.description:
Amount of easing to be applied. A normalized floating point value of 0.-1. sets the amount of easing interpolation to be applied between successive values.
The default is 1 (full easing), a value of 0 results in linear interpolation (no easing). This setting is dependent on the interp amount.

attribute.name: interp
attribute.digest: Amount of interpolation to be applied
attribute.description:
Amount of interpolation to be applied. A normalized floating point value of 0.-1. sets the amount of fundamental interpolation to be applied between successive values.
The default is 1 (full interpolation), a value of 0 results in clipped sample jumps.

method.name: signal
method.description: Override initial frequency. Any signal will be interpreted as frequency in Hz to fade between successive values.
